titles.title: To direct the Secretary of Agriculture to release the reversionary interest of the United States in certain land located in Sumter County, South Carolina, to facilitate a land exchange involving that land and to provide for an exchange of the mineral interests of the United States in that land.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Agriculture, and in addition to the Committee on Resources, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Department Operations, Oversight, Nutrition and Forestry.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Mineral Resources.

committee.subcommittee: Department Operations, Oversight, Nutrition, and Forestry
committee.name: House Agriculture

bill.summary: 9/7/2000--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of Agriculture to release the reversionary interest of the United States in a specified tract of land in Sumter County, South Carolina, that: (1) requires that it be used for public purposes; and (2) is contained in the deed conveying such land from the United States to the South Carolina State Commission of Forestry. Directs the Secretary of the Interior to convey to the Commission all of the undivided mineral interests of the United States in that land in exchange for mineral rights of equal value held by the State of South Carolina in other specified parcels.Directs the State of South Carolina, as consideration for the release of such reversionary interest, to transfer to the United States a vested future interest, similar to the restriction described above, in another specified tract of land.
